function.name: virConnectGetVersion
function.info: Returns the running hypervisor version of the connection host

return.info: 0 on success, -1 on error

function.name: virConnectGetLibVersion
function.info: Returns the libvirt version of the connection host

return.info: 0 on success, -1 on error

function.name: virConnectListDomainsID
function.info: Returns the list of the ID of the domains on the hypervisor

return.info: the list of ID or None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListDefinedDomains
function.info: list the defined domains, stores the pointers to the names in @names

return.info: the list of Names or None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListAllDomains
function.info: returns list of all defined domains

return.info: the list of domains or None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListNetworks
function.info: list the networks, stores the pointers to the names in @names

return.info: the list of Names or None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListDefinedNetworks
function.info: list the defined networks, stores the pointers to the names in @names

return.info: the list of Names or None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListAllNetworks
function.info: returns list of all networks

return.info: the list of networks or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainLookupByUUID
function.info: Try to lookup a domain on the given hypervisor based on its UUID.

return.info: a new domain object or NULL in case of failure

arg.name: uuid
arg.info: the UUID string for the domain, must be 16 bytes

function.name: virNetworkLookupByUUID
function.info: Try to lookup a network on the given hypervisor based on its UUID.

return.info: a new network object or NULL in case of failure

arg.name: uuid
arg.info: the UUID string for the network, must be 16 bytes

function.name: virNetworkPortLookupByUUID
function.info: Try to lookup a port on the given network based on its UUID.

return.info: a new network port object or NULL in case of failure

arg.name: uuid
arg.info: the UUID string for the network port, must be 16 bytes

function.name: virDomainGetInfo
function.info: Extract information about a domain. Note that if the connection used to get the domain is limited only a partial set of the information can be extracted.

return.info: the list of information or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainGetState
function.info: Extract domain state.

return.info: the list containing state and reason or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainGetControlInfo
function.info: Extract details about current state of control interface to a domain.

return.info: the list of information or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainGetBlockInfo
function.info: Extract information about a domain block device size

return.info: the list of information or None in case of error

arg.name: path
arg.info: path to the block device or file

function.name: virDomainGetJobInfo
function.info: Extract information about an active job being processed for a domain.

return.info: the list of information or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainGetJobStats
function.info: Extract information about an active job being processed for a domain.

return.info: dictionary mapping field names to values or None in case of error

function.name: virNodeGetInfo
function.info: Extract hardware information about the Node. Note that the memory size is reported in MiB instead of KiB.

return.info: the list of information or None in case of error

function.name: virNodeGetSecurityModel
function.info: Extract information about the hypervisor security model

return.info: the list of information or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainGetSecurityLabel
function.info: Extract information about the domain security label. Only the first label will be returned.

return.info: the list of information or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainGetSecurityLabelList
function.info: Extract information about the domain security label. A list of all labels will be returned.

return.info: the list of information or None in case of error

function.name: virNodeGetCPUStats
function.info: Extract node's CPU statistics.

return.info: dictionary mapping field names to values or None in case of error

arg.name: cpuNum
arg.info: number of node cpu. (VIR_NODE_CPU_STATS_ALL_CPUS means total cpu statistics)

function.name: virNodeGetMemoryStats
function.info: Extract node's memory statistics.

return.info: dictionary mapping field names to values or None in case of error

arg.name: cellNum
arg.info: number of node cell. (VIR_NODE_MEMORY_STATS_ALL_CELLS means total cell statistics)

function.name: virDomainGetUUID
function.info: Extract the UUID unique Identifier of a domain.

return.info: the 16 bytes string or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainGetUUIDString
function.info: Fetch globally unique ID of the domain as a string.

return.info: the UUID string or None in case of error

function.name: virNetworkGetUUID
function.info: Extract the UUID unique Identifier of a network.

return.info: the 16 bytes string or None in case of error

function.name: virNetworkGetUUIDString
function.info: Fetch globally unique ID of the network as a string.

return.info: the UUID string or None in case of error

function.name: virNetworkPortGetUUID
function.info: Extract the UUID unique Identifier of a network port.

return.info: the 16 bytes string or None in case of error

function.name: virNetworkPortGetUUIDString
function.info: Fetch globally unique ID of the network port as a string.

return.info: the UUID string or None in case of error

function.name: virStoragePoolGetUUID
function.info: Extract the UUID unique Identifier of a storage pool.

return.info: the 16 bytes string or None in case of error

function.name: virStoragePoolGetUUIDString
function.info: Fetch globally unique ID of the storage pool as a string.

return.info: the UUID string or None in case of error

function.name: virNetworkGetAutostart
function.info: Extract the autostart flag for a network.

return.info: the autostart flag, or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainGetAutostart
function.info: Extract the autostart flag for a domain

return.info: the autostart flag, or None in case of error

function.name: virStoragePoolGetAutostart
function.info: Extract the autostart flag for a storage pool

return.info: the autostart flag, or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainBlockStats
function.info: Extracts block device statistics for a domain

return.info: a tuple of statistics

arg.name: path
arg.info: the path for the block device

function.name: virDomainBlockStatsFlags
function.info: Extracts block device statistics parameters of a running domain

return.info: None in case of error, returns a dictionary of params

arg.name: path
arg.info: the path for the block device

function.name: virDomainGetCPUStats
function.info: Extracts CPU statistics for a running domain. On success it will return a list of data of dictionary type. If boolean total is False or 0, the first element of the list refers to CPU0 on the host, second element is CPU1, and so on. The format of data struct is as follows: [{cpu_time:xxx}, {cpu_time:xxx}, ...] If it is True or 1, it returns total domain CPU statistics in the format of [{cpu_time:xxx, user_time:xxx, system_time:xxx}]

return.info: returns a list of dictionary in case of success, None in case of error

arg.name: total
arg.info: on true, return total domain CPU statistics, false return per-cpu info

function.name: virDomainInterfaceStats
function.info: Extracts interface device statistics for a domain

return.info: a tuple of statistics

arg.name: path
arg.info: the path for the interface device

function.name: virDomainMemoryStats
function.info: Extracts memory statistics for a domain

return.info: a dictionary of statistics

function.name: virNodeGetCellsFreeMemory
function.info: Returns the available memory for a list of cells

arg.name: maxCells
arg.info: number of cell in the list

return.info: the list available memory in the cells

function.name: virDomainGetSchedulerParameters
function.info: Get the scheduler parameters, the @params array will be filled with the values.

return.info: None in case of error, returns a dictionary of params.

function.name: virDomainGetSchedulerParametersFlags
function.info: Get the scheduler parameters

return.info: None in case of error, returns a dictionary of params

function.name: virDomainGetSchedulerType
function.info: Get the scheduler type.

return.info: NULL in case of error. The caller must free the returned string.

function.name: virDomainGetVcpus
function.info: Extract information about virtual CPUs of domain, store it in info array and also in cpumaps.

return.info: None in case of error, returns a tuple of vcpu info and vcpu map.

arg.name: domain
arg.info: pointer to domain object, or NULL for Domain0

function.name: virDomainPinVcpu
function.info: Dynamically change the real CPUs which can be allocated to a virtual CPU. This function requires privileged access to the hypervisor.

return.info: 0 in case of success, -1 in case of failure.

arg.name: domain
arg.info: pointer to domain object, or NULL for Domain0

arg.name: cpumap
arg.info: pointer to a bit map of real CPUs (in 8-bit bytes) (IN) Each bit set to 1 means that corresponding CPU is usable. Bytes are stored in little-endian order: CPU0-7, 8-15... In each byte, lowest CPU number is least significant bit.

function.name: virDomainPinVcpuFlags
function.info: Dynamically change the real CPUs which can be allocated to a virtual CPU. This function requires privileged access to the hypervisor.

return.info: 0 in case of success, -1 in case of failure.

arg.name: domain
arg.info: pointer to domain object, or NULL for Domain0

arg.name: cpumap
arg.info: pointer to a bit map of real CPUs (in 8-bit bytes) (IN) Each bit set to 1 means that corresponding CPU is usable. Bytes are stored in little-endian order: CPU0-7, 8-15... In each byte, lowest CPU number is least significant bit.

function.name: virDomainGetVcpuPinInfo
function.info: Query the CPU affinity setting of all virtual CPUs of domain

return.info: the array of cpumap

arg.name: domain
arg.info: pointer to domain object, or NULL for Domain0

function.name: virDomainGetEmulatorPinInfo
function.info: Query the CPU affinity setting of the emulator process of domain

return.info: the array of cpumap

function.name: virDomainPinEmulator
function.info: Dynamically change the real CPUs which can be allocated to the emulator process of a domain. This function requires privileged access to the hypervisor.

return.info: 0 in case of success, -1 in case of failure.

arg.name: domain
arg.info: pointer to domain object, or NULL for Domain0

arg.name: cpumap
arg.info: pointer to a bit map of real CPUs (in 8-bit bytes) (IN) Each bit set to 1 means that corresponding CPU is usable. Bytes are stored in little-endian order: CPU0-7, 8-15... In each byte, lowest CPU number is least significant bit.

function.name: virDomainGetIOThreadInfo
function.info: Query the CPU affinity setting of the IOThreads of the domain

arg.name: domain
arg.info: pointer to domain object, or NULL for Domain0

return.info: list of IOThreads information including the iothread_id, the cpumap, and the cpumap length for each iothread_id.

function.name: virDomainPinIOThread
function.info: Dynamically change the real CPUs which can be allocated to an IOThread. This function requires privileged access to the hypervisor.

return.info: 0 in case of success, -1 in case of failure.

arg.name: cpumap
arg.info: pointer to a bit map of real CPUs (in 8-bit bytes) (IN) Each bit set to 1 means that corresponding CPU is usable. Bytes are stored in little-endian order: CPU0-7, 8-15... In each byte, lowest CPU number is least significant bit.

function.name: virDomainSetIOThreadParams
function.info: Dynamically allow changing the IOThread polling related parameters. This function requires privileged access to the hypervisor.

return.info: 0 in case of success, -1 in case of failure.

arg.name: params
arg.info: pointer to IOThread polling parameter objects

function.name: virDomainSetSchedulerParameters
function.info: Change the scheduler parameters

return.info: -1 in case of error, 0 in case of success.

function.name: virDomainSetSchedulerParametersFlags
function.info: Change the scheduler parameters

return.info: -1 in case of error, 0 in case of success.

function.name: virDomainSetBlkioParameters
function.info: Change the blkio tunables

return.info: -1 in case of error, 0 in case of success.

function.name: virDomainGetBlkioParameters
function.info: Get the blkio parameters

return.info: None in case of error, returns a dictionary of params

function.name: virDomainSetMemoryParameters
function.info: Change the memory tunables

return.info: -1 in case of error, 0 in case of success.

function.name: virDomainGetMemoryParameters
function.info: Get the memory parameters

return.info: None in case of error, returns a dictionary of params

function.name: virDomainSetNumaParameters
function.info: Change the NUMA tunables

return.info: -1 in case of error, 0 in case of success.

function.name: virDomainGetNumaParameters
function.info: Get the NUMA parameters

return.info: returns a dictionary of params in case of success, None in case of error

function.name: virDomainGetPerfEvents
function.info: Get all perf events setting.

return.info: returns a dictionary of params in case of success, None in case of error

function.name: virDomainSetPerfEvents
function.info: Enable or disable the particular list of perf events

return.info: -1 in case of error, 0 in case of success.

arg.name: params
arg.info: pointer to perf events parameter object

function.name: virDomainSetInterfaceParameters
function.info: Change the bandwidth tunables for a interface device

arg.name: params
arg.info: Pointer to bandwidth tuning params object

return.info: 0 in case of success, -1 in case of failure

function.name: virDomainGetInterfaceParameters
function.info: Get the bandwidth tunables for a interface device

return.info: the bandwidth tunables value or None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListStoragePools
function.info: list the storage pools, stores the pointers to the names in @names

return.info: the list of Names of None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListDefinedStoragePools
function.info: list the defined storage pool, stores the pointers to the names in @names

return.info: the list of Names of None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListAllStoragePools
function.info: returns list of all storage pools

return.info: the list of pools or None in case of error

function.name: virStoragePoolListVolumes
function.info: list the storage volumes, stores the pointers to the names in @names

return.info: the list of Names or None in case of error

function.name: virStoragePoolListAllVolumes
function.info: return list of storage volume objects

return.info: the list of volumes or None in case of error

function.name: virStoragePoolGetInfo
function.info: Extract information about a storage pool. Note that if the connection used to get the domain is limited only a partial set of the information can be extracted.

return.info: the list of information or None in case of error

function.name: virStorageVolGetInfo
function.info: Extract information about a storage volume. Note that if the connection used to get the domain is limited only a partial set of the information can be extracted.

return.info: the list of information or None in case of error

function.name: virStorageVolGetInfoFlags
function.info: Extract information about a storage volume. Note that if the connection used to get the domain is limited only a partial set of the information can be extracted.

return.info: the list of information or None in case of error

function.name: virNodeListDevices
function.info: list the node devices

return.info: the list of Names or None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListAllNodeDevices
function.info: returns list of all host node devices

return.info: the list of host node device or None in case of error

function.name: virNodeDeviceListCaps
function.info: list the node device's capabilities

return.info: the list of Names or None in case of error

function.name: virSecretGetValue
function.info: Fetches the value associated with a secret.

return.info: the secret value or None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListSecrets
function.info: List the defined secret IDs

return.info: the list of secret IDs or None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListAllSecrets
function.info: returns list of all interfaces

return.info: the list of secrets or None in case of error

function.name: virSecretSetValue
function.info: Associates a value with a secret.

return.info: 0 on success, -1 on failure.

function.name: virSecretLookupByUUID
function.info: Try to lookup a secret on the given hypervisor based on its UUID.

return.info: a new secret object or NULL in case of failure

arg.name: uuid
arg.info: the UUID string for the secret, must be 16 bytes

function.name: virSecretGetUUID
function.info: Extract the UUID unique Identifier of a secret.

return.info: the 16 bytes string or None in case of error

function.name: virSecretGetUUIDString
function.info: Fetch globally unique ID of the secret as a string.

return.info: the UUID string or None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListNWFilters
function.info: List the defined network filters

return.info: the list of network filter IDs or None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListAllNWFilters
function.info: returns list of all network fitlers

return.info: the list of network filters or None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListAllNWFilterBindings
function.info: returns list of all network fitler bindings

return.info: the list of network filter bindings or None in case of error

function.name: virNWFilterLookupByUUID
function.info: Try to lookup a network filter on the given hypervisor based on its UUID.

return.info: a new network filter object or NULL in case of failure

arg.name: uuid
arg.info: the UUID string for the secret, must be 16 bytes

function.name: virNWFilterGetUUID
function.info: Extract the UUID unique Identifier of a network filter.

return.info: the 16 bytes string or None in case of error

function.name: virNWFilterGetUUIDString
function.info: Fetch globally unique ID of the network filter as a string.

return.info: the UUID string or None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListInterfaces
function.info: list the running interfaces, stores the pointers to the names in @names

return.info: the list of Names of None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListDefinedInterfaces
function.info: list the defined interfaces, stores the pointers to the names in @names

return.info: the list of Names of None in case of error

function.name: virConnectListAllInterfaces
function.info: returns list of all interfaces

return.info: the list of interfaces or None in case of error

function.name: virConnectBaselineCPU
function.info: Computes the most feature-rich CPU which is compatible with all given host CPUs.

return.info: XML description of the computed CPU or NULL on error.

arg.name: xmlCPUs
arg.info: array of XML descriptions of host CPUs

function.name: virConnectGetCPUModelNames
function.info: Get the list of supported CPU models.

return.info: list of supported CPU models

function.name: virDomainSnapshotListNames
function.info: collect the list of snapshot names for the given domain

return.info: the list of Names or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainListAllSnapshots
function.info: returns the list of snapshots for the given domain

return.info: the list of snapshots or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainSnapshotListChildrenNames
function.info: collect the list of child snapshot names for the given snapshot

return.info: the list of Names or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainSnapshotListAllChildren
function.info: returns the list of child snapshots for the given snapshot

return.info: the list of snapshots or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainRevertToSnapshot
function.info: revert the domain to the given snapshot

return.info: 0 on success, -1 on error

function.name: virDomainListAllCheckpoints
function.info: returns the list of checkpoints for the given domain

return.info: the list of checkpoints or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainCheckpointListAllChildren
function.info: collect the list of child checkpoint names for the given checkpoint

return.info: the list of checkpoints or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainGetBlockJobInfo
function.info: Get progress information for a block job

return.info: A dictionary containing job information.

function.name: virDomainMigrateGetCompressionCache
function.info: Get current size of the cache (in bytes) used for compressing repeatedly transferred memory pages during live migration.

return.info: current cache size, or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainMigrateGetMaxSpeed
function.info: Get currently configured maximum migration speed for a domain

return.info: current max migration speed, or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainMigrateGetMaxDowntime
function.info: Get the current value of the maximum downtime (in milliseconds) allowed during a migration of a guest.

return.info: current downtime or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainMigrate3
function.info: Migrate the domain object from its current host to the destination host given by dconn (a connection to the destination host).

arg.name: dconn
arg.info: pointer to the destination host connection

return.info: a new domain object or NULL in case of failure

function.name: virDomainMigrateToURI3
function.info: Migrate the domain object from its current host to the destination host given by URI.

arg.name: dconnuri
arg.info: URI for target libvirtd if @flags includes VIR_MIGRATE_PEER2PEER

return.info: 0 in case of success, -1 in case of failure.

function.name: virDomainSetBlockIoTune
function.info: Change the I/O tunables for a block device

arg.name: params
arg.info: Pointer to blkio tuning params object

return.info: 0 in case of success, -1 in case of failure

function.name: virDomainGetBlockIoTune
function.info: Get the I/O tunables for a block device

return.info: the I/O tunables value or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainBlockPeek
function.info: Read the contents of domain's disk device

return.info: the returned buffer or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainMemoryPeek
function.info: Read the contents of domain's memory

return.info: the returned buffer or None in case of error

function.name: virDomainGetDiskErrors
function.info: Extract errors on disk devices.

return.info: dictionary of disks and their errors or None in case of error

function.name: virNodeSetMemoryParameters
function.info: Change the node memory tunables

return.info: -1 in case of error, 0 in case of success.

arg.name: params
arg.info: pointer to the memory tunable objects

function.name: virNodeGetMemoryParameters
function.info: Get the node memory parameters

return.info: None in case of error, returns a dictionary of params

function.name: virNodeGetCPUMap
function.info: Get node CPU information

return.info: (cpunum, cpumap, online) on success, None on error

function.name: virNodeGetFreePages
function.info: Returns the number of available pages for a list of cells and page sizes

arg.name: maxCells
arg.info: number of cell in the list

return.info: the list available memory in the cells

function.name: virNetworkGetDHCPLeases
function.info: Returns a list of dhcp leases for interfaces connected to the given virtual network

return.info: list of leases

function.name: virDomainBlockCopy
function.info: Copy the guest-visible contents of a disk image to a new file described by destxml

arg.name: disk
arg.info: path to the block device, or device shorthand

arg.name: destxml
arg.info: XML description of the copy destination

arg.name: params
arg.info: optional pointer to block copy parameter object, or NULL

return.info: 0 if the operation has started, -1 on failure

function.name: virNodeAllocPages
function.info: Allocate or free some pages in the huge pages pool

arg.name: pages
arg.info: dictionary of desired page sizes, key is page size, value is page count

arg.name: startCell
arg.info: optional first cell in the list

arg.name: cellCount
arg.info: optional number of cell in the list

return.info: the number of nodes successfully adjusted or -1 in case of an error

function.name: virDomainGetFSInfo
function.info: Get a list of mapping information for each mounted file systems within the specified guest and the disks.

return.info: list of mounted filesystems information

function.name: virDomainInterfaceAddresses
function.info: returns a dictionary of domain interfaces along with their MAC and IP addresses

arg.name: flags
arg.info: extra flags; not used yet, so callers should always pass 0

return.info: dictionary of domain interfaces along with their MAC and IP addresses

function.name: virDomainGetGuestVcpus
function.info: returns a dictionary containing information regarding guest vcpus

arg.name: flags
arg.info: extra flags; not used yet, so callers should always pass 0

return.info: dictionary of vcpu data returned by the guest agent

function.name: virConnectBaselineHypervisorCPU
function.info: Computes the most feature-rich CPU which is compatible with all given CPUs and can be provided by the specified hypervisor.

return.info: XML description of the computed CPU or NULL on error.

arg.name: xmlCPUs
arg.info: array of XML descriptions of CPUs

function.name: virDomainGetLaunchSecurityInfo
function.info: Get launch security info for a domain

return.info: None in case of error, returns a dictionary of params

function.name: virNodeGetSEVInfo
function.info: Get platform specific information from the SEV firmware

return.info: None in case of error, returns a dictionary of params

function.name: virConnectGetDomainCapabilities
function.info: Query domain capabilities

return.info: NULL in case of error or an XML string defining the capabilities.

function.name: virNetworkPortSetParameters
function.info: Change the port tunables

return.info: -1 in case of error, 0 in case of success.

function.name: virNetworkPortGetParameters
function.info: Get the port parameters

return.info: None in case of error, returns a dictionary of params

function.name: virDomainGetGuestInfo
function.info: Get aggregated info from guest agent

return.info: None in case of error, returns a dictionary of params

function.name: virConnectSetIdentity
function.info: Override the default identity information associated with the connection.

return.info: 0 if the identity change was accepted, -1 on error
